item.title: Amy add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Goodbye," said the fox. "And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Amy add a quote by Abraham as told by Esther Hicks
item.description: "The main event has never been the manifestation; the main event has always been the way you feel moment by moment, because that's what life is." -- Abraham as told by Esther Hicks

item.title: Amy add a quote by Epictetus
item.description: "People are not disturbed by things, but by the views they take of them." -- Epictetus

item.title: Amy add a quote by Epictetus
item.description: "The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best." -- Epictetus

item.title: Amy add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Amy add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be." -- May Sarton

item.title: Amy add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Do not fear to be eccentric in opinion, for every opinion now accepted was once eccentric." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Amy add a quote by Stephen Hawking
item.description: "Even if there is only one possible unified theory, it is just a set of rules and equations. What is it that breathes fire into the equations and makes a universe for them to describe? The usual approach of science of constructing a mathematical model cannot answer the questions of why there should be a universe for the model to describe. Why does the universe go to all the bother of existing?" -- Stephen Hawking

item.title: Amy add a quote by Benjamin Spock
item.description: "Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do." -- Benjamin Spock

item.title: Amy add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Amy add a quote by Dan Brown
item.description: "Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand." -- Dan Brown

item.title: Amy add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White
